DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Result Report Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the outcome from a Positron Emmision Tomography (PET) imaging study.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._A specific result or effect that can be measured. Examples of outcomes include decreased pain, reduced tumor size, and improvement of disease._A short textual account; having provided a short account.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.
